snippet: A federal report found that hitting the corporate average of 54.5 miles per gallon might not be as difficult as the industry had feared.
abstract: Wheels column; sweeping report commissioned by the National Highway Traffic Safety Admin finds that auto industry may in fact be on track to reach mandated corporate fuel efficiency average of 54.5 miles per gallon by 2025 with less difficulty than expected; cites shift to higher-tech, smaller-cylinder engines as well as the use of lighter materials.
lead_paragraph: A federal report found that hitting the corporate average of 54.5 miles per gallon might not be as difficult as the industry had feared.

headline.main: For Automakers, Fuel Economy Targets May Be Less of a Stretch
headline.print_headline: For Automakers, Fuel Economy Targets May Be Within Reach
